Interactive Robot Hand

interactive_robot_hand: interactive_robot_hand

Package for the interactive robot hand. This package is part of the first assignment for the minor robotics.

  • Homepage: http://ros.org/wiki/interactive_robot_hand

Introduction

This is the documentation for the interactive robot hand software. This software was created as part of the gripper assignment for the minor robotics.

Usage

Step 1: Resolve dependencies

Get the software from github by cloning the repository, for example: 

cd ~/ros


git clone https://github.com/rjagerman/interactive_robot_hand

Step 1: Resolve dependencies

To use the software make sure all dependency are correctly resolved. In particular it is necessary to have threemxl and phidget_ik correctly compiled and working.

Step 2: Compile the software

To compile the software, use: 

rosmake interactive_robot_hand

Step 3: Run the software

To run the software, use: 

roslaunch interactive_robot_hand solution.launch

Note that you will be asked to enter a force into the console when everything works correctly. After entering a force, placing an object near the gripper will cause it to grasp that object with the previously specified amount of force. In general you want the force to be somewhere between 2 and 9 newton.
